required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Aerosol in a Dental Clinic
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Aerosol in a Dental Clinic

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of external evacuation units and mouth rinses during aerosol generating procedures in a dental clinic and to determine the risk level to the dental practitioners during aerosol generating procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of bacterial colony forming units (CFUs) .

arm_group.arm_group_label: High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and hydrogen peroxide
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide
HVE suction and external evacuation device (EED) and hydrogen peroxide

intervention.description: Intra oral suction will be done and during the procedure,bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab.Patient will be given hydrogen peroxide rinse.
intervention.arm_group_label: HVE suction and external evacuation device (EED) and hydrogen peroxide
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and hydrogen peroxide

intervention.description: Extraoral suction connected to dental suction will be used and bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab.Patient will be given hydrogen peroxide rinse.
intervention.arm_group_label: HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide

intervention.description: Extraoral suction unit will be used and bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab.Patient will be given hydrogen peroxide rinse.
intervention.arm_group_label: HVE suction and external evacuation device (EED) and hydrogen peroxide

intervention.description: Subjects will be given 1.5 % Oral Solution of hydrogen peroxide mouth rinse
intervention.arm_group_label: HVE suction and external evacuation device (EED) and hydrogen peroxide
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and hydrogen peroxide

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- prepping natural teeth at the appointment
- at least an hour long procedure
- procedure will be the first one in the morning
